intro: Hieronyma cubana, commonly known as Cuban hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink and red. The plant has heart-shaped leaves and produces capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is adapted to grow in well-drained soils. Hieronyma cubana thrives in tropical and subtropical climates.
